title: Elementary English 207
headline: This free online English course explains how to use continuous tenses and provides useful vocabulary related to driving.
description: This English course explains how to discuss driving and motoring in English. Using your newfound vocabulary, we describe the grammatical rules concerning the use of participles in the present and past continuous tense. We then introduce you to the past continuous tense and explain its forms and uses. Finally, we compare the past continuous and past simple tenses to give you the confidence you need to speak English.
courseDescription:
Being capable of holding a conversation in English is a valuable skill you can use worldwide. This English course builds on your grammar and vocabulary skills and enhances your comprehension and understanding of this global language. It begins with an overview of vocabulary related to car parts before introducing you to everyday words about driving on the road.

The course then lays out some grammar rules and uses the new words you have learned to demonstrate how they work. We first review the present participle and its use in the present continuous tense. Present participles are verbs ending with '-ing,' and you use the present continuous tense to describe the events as they unfold. We then compare the past continuous to the past simple tense to discuss events that have already occurred.

Our final topic improves your reading, speaking, and writing skills. Videos help you refine your accent and pronunciation. We also provide a writing activity to let you practice what you have learned in the course's 'Resource' section. This course is an excellent place to start if you really want to learn English. Sign up to master continuous tenses and enrich your English skills while you use your new vocabulary to start chatting with confidence.
